  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Factory Manager (Bakery Operation)",
  "description": "Elizabeth Maddeux provides a range of human resources solutions designed to empower your workforce, enhance technical proficiency, refine soft skills, and accelerateorganizational growth for better impacts by enhancing organizational dynamics through a well-rounded and robust human resource intervention.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory Manager (Bakery Operation)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Overview


	We are seeking a proactive and seasoned Factory Manager to lead end-to-end operations of our client&rsquo;s bakery plant in Abuja.
	The ideal candidate must be able to seamlessly coordinate production, people, marketing support, logistics, financial controls, quality assurance, and general administration in a high-speed, high-volume environment.
	This individual will be the strategic and operational backbone of our manufacturing facility, driving performance, compliance, innovation, and profitability.


Key&nbsp;Responsibility
Production &amp; Operational Management:


	Oversee daily bakery production processes, including mixing, baking, packaging, storage, and dispatch.
	Maintain optimal production efficiency by aligning labor, machines, and materials with demand and sales forecasts.
	Introduce and implement continuous improvement methodologies (Kaizen, Lean) to reduce waste and enhance productivity.
	Monitor production KPIs, downtime, batch yields, and daily output, ensuring adherence to defined targets.


Strategic Planning &amp; Execution:


	Collaborate with senior management to define and execute long-term operational strategies.
	Identify growth opportunities, drive factory expansion, and implement new production lines or processes.


People Management:


	Lead a diverse team of production staff, shift supervisors, quality controllers, and drivers.
	Design and implement performance reviews, skills development programs, and conflict resolution processes.
	Foster a productive, safe, and inclusive work environment.
	Enforce discipline and ensure compliance with labor laws and union expectations, if applicable.


Financial Oversight &amp; Cost Management:


	Prepare and manage factory operating budgets, track overheads, and optimize cost per unit.
	Authorize expenditure, control production-related costs, and ensure proper documentation of financial processes.
	Collaborate with finance and procurement to control raw material usage and reconcile&nbsp;variances.


Resource Planning &amp; Inventory Management:


	Supervise procurement planning, inventory levels, stock rotation, and spoilage controls.
	Ensure accurate records of raw materials, work-in-progress, and finished goods.
	Introduce stock movement tracking systems for real-time insights.


Marketing Support &amp; Sales Alignment:


	Coordinate with the marketing team to forecast production based on promotions and seasonal trends.
	Provide insights on marketable packaging, pricing, and product innovations to align with customer demands.


Vendor, Fleet &amp; Maintenance Management:


	Maintain strong vendor relationships for raw material, packaging, and equipment procurement.
	Oversee factory maintenance schedules, ensure preventive maintenance and emergency repairs are conducted promptly.
	Supervise fleet operations, including daily route planning, driver compliance, and vehicle servicing.


Facility &amp; General Office Administration:


	Supervise the daily administration of the factory premises, including security, sanitation, visitor protocols, and record-keeping.
	Coordinate third-party services such as cleaning, security, waste management, etc.
	Ensure compliance with health &amp; safety laws, fire protocols, and factory regulations.


Quality Assurance &amp; Regulatory Compliance:


	Ensure factory operations are aligned with NAFDAC, SON, HACCP, and other food safety standards.
	Investigate quality issues and establish preventive measures.


Reporting &amp; Process Development:


	Design, document, and standardize production processes and SOPs for all operational areas.
	Submit weekly, monthly, and quarterly operational reports with actionable insights to management.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Food Technology, Engineering, Operations Management, or related field.
	Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in a factory/ plant management role in the FMCG industry.
	Demonstrated experience managing a factory workforce, operations budget, and production lifecycle.
	Strong leadership, problem-solving, and analytical thinking abilities.
	Familiarity with ERP or production software is an added advantage.


What you will gain


	Salary: N300,000 - N500,000 Monthly.&nbsp;
	Annual performance bonus
	Dynamic, innovative, and supportive work culture
	Health Insurance (HMO)
	Career growth within a progressive and expanding manufacturing company.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@elizabethmaddeux.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Factory Manager- Bakery Operations&rdquo; as the subject of the email.&nbsp;",

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@elizabethmaddeux.com using “Factory Manager- Bakery Operations” as the subject of the email.

Internal Control Officer Job at Esosa Food Systems and Innovations Limited




        
    

        
        Esosa Food Systems and Innovations Limited - We are a key food innovation company with innovative baked products and services. We produce high-quality baked goods under hygienic conditions using the most modern facilities. Our vision is "to be the leading food innovation company in Nigeria by 2026" with the mission of "utilizing innovative resources to build a world-class food brand that creates exceptional customer experience while surpassing stakeholders' expectations".

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Conducting regular control checks on cash, inventory, expenses, dispatch and production reports.
	Reporting any discrepancies identified to the Internal Auditor.
	Conducting risk assessment of all departments.
	Reporting risk management issues and internal control deficiencies identified directly to the Manager and the Management and providing recommendations for improving the organization's operations.
	Evaluating and ensuring compliance with the existing company policies and procedures, identifying and proposing modifications as needed.
	Identifying areas of strength and weakness and engaging in continuous education and staff development.
	Reviewing the responses to internal and external audit management letters and queries to ensure that recommendations are implemented and to ensure that all action items are resolved.
	Evaluating information security and associated risk exposures.
	Evaluating regulatory compliance programs.
	Evaluating the organization's readiness in case of business interruption.
	Providing support to the company's anti-fraud programs.
	Preparation of centre monthly audit reports.
	All other duties as reasonably requested by the Internal Auditor or Management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: recruitment@esosafoodsystems.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Must reside in Ajah / environs or on the Island.

Administrative Executive Job at Esosa Food Systems and Innovations Limited




        
    

        
        Esosa Food Systems and Innovations Limited - We are a key food innovation company with innovative baked products and services. We produce high-quality baked goods under hygienic conditions using the most modern facilities. Our vision is "to be the leading food innovation company in Nigeria by 2026" with the mission of "utilizing innovative resources to build a world-class food brand that creates exceptional customer experience while surpassing stakeholders' expectations".

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Executive

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Ensuring that fresh ingredients and supplies are available when daily production starts in the early morning hours.
	Monitoring the material issuing process and ensuring that materials are issued only according to the standard given by the Manager
	Establishing a professional brand, consistent image and stellar reputation for the company.
	Maintaining daily attendance records.
	Planning and coordinating administrative procedures and systems and devising ways to streamline processes.
	Ensuring the smooth and adequate flow of information within the organization to facilitate business operations.
	Booking and arranging travel, transportation, and accommodation.
	Typing, compiling and preparing reports, presentations, and correspondences.
	Ensuring that the office and company environment is thoroughly clean and presentable.
	Ensuring that operations adhere to the company’s policies and regulations.
	Liaising with vendors and suppliers on behalf of the company.
	Acting as the first point of contact and dealing with correspondence and phone calls.
	Authorizing fuel vouchers for the release of fuel to office vehicles and monitoring its usage.
	Monitoring costs and expenses to assist the Manager in budget preparation.
	Monitoring inventory of office supplies and the purchase of new materials paying full attention to budgetary constraints.
	Receiving visitors and directing them to the appropriate offices.
	Preparing weekly reports on material usage, office cleaning schedule, maintenance sheet and fuel reconciliation sheet.
	Managing diaries, organizing meetings and appointments; often controlling access to the Manager.
	Managing databases and filing systems for proper recording, documentation and safekeeping of files and records.
	Collating and filing expenses incurred in the operation of the business.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: recruitment@esosafoodsystems.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Must reside in Ajah / environs or on the Island.

	Strong understanding of the Nigerian financial market and customer behavior.
	Proven track record of brand building, digital transformation, and marketing-led growth.
	Exceptional leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
	Analytical mindset with a data-driven approach to marketing.
	Experience in customer segmentation, campaign management, and CRM systems.


What We Offer


	Competitive executive remuneration and performance-based incentives.
	A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
	Opportunity to shape the future of microfinance in Nigeria.
	Professional growth and leadership development.


Method of Application
